title: Suppose that we have a fuse box containing 20 fuses, of which 5 are defective. If 2 fuses are selected at random and removed from the box in succession without replacing the first, what is the probability that both fuses are defective? - Quora

response.answer_text: Probability of getting 1 st defective fuse =5/20 =1/4 Now, second fuse is selected without replacing the first, it means the box has 4 defective fuses out of total 19 fuses. P(getting second defective fuse) =4/19 P(both the fuses defective) = 1/4× 4/19 =1/19.

Second verse, same as the first. P(B∣A)=4/19 because when given that you have selected one defective fuse ... If you've done combinations, you see that there are (53)=10 ways to choose any 3 of the 5 defective fuses. There are (203)=1140 ways of choosing 3 fuses at random from the 20 fuses.
